conclusion: Analyze effects of moving light source on shadows of four objects.
Four objects on a flat surface casting shadows: smooth rounded object, black rectangular object, small leaf-like object, round orange object.
Shadows fall in direction opposite to light source.
Identify initial positions and sizes of shadows (A, B, C, D) on the ground.
Understand light source's current position above the objects.
Simulate light source moving forward towards the objects.
Shadows (A, B, C, D) become larger and more defined as light source moves closer.
Length of shadows increases because light source is closer, casting elongated shadows.
Shadows increase in size and darkness due to closer proximity of light source.
Image shows four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Identify position and size of shadows (A, B, C, D) in the image.
Understand current position of light source relative to objects and shadows.
Simulate light source moving forward towards the objects.
Shadows (A, B, C, D) become larger and darker as light source gets closer.
Shadows will be longer because light source is closer to objects, casting elongated shadows.
Shadows cast by objects will increase in size and darkness as light source moves forward.
